Jx.Adapter.Tree.Object

This class adapts a table adhering to the classic Parent-style “tree table”.

This adaptor does not use a store.  Instead, it depends on a basic object where each entry has a “children” property that contains it’s children.  The object would look like:

[{
 label: <label>,
 icon: <image>,
 children: [{},{},{}]
 },...]

In order to get the data, simply pass in a configured Jx.Store.Protocol subclass that it can use to acces the data.

Copyright 2010 by Jonathan Bomgardner License: mit-style

Summary
Jx.Adapter.Tree.ObjectThis class adapts a table adhering to the classic Parent-style “tree table”.
Options
protocolA Jx.Store.Protocol subclass to use in accessing the data for this adaptor
folderOptionsA Hash containing the options for <Jx.TreeFolder>.
itemOptionsA Hash containing the options for <Jx.TreeItem>.
labelPropertyconfigure the property of the label in the objects of the data.

Options

protocol

A Jx.Store.Protocol subclass to use in accessing the data for this adaptor

folderOptions

A Hash containing the options for <Jx.TreeFolder>.  Defaults to null.

itemOptions

A Hash containing the options for <Jx.TreeItem>.  Defaults to null.

labelProperty

configure the property of the label in the objects of the data.  Defaults to ‘label’ for be backward compatible.

Extends: Jx.Object
